SENT.plain: We report on a patient with Marfan's syndrome, with coexistent obstructive sleep hypopnea (OSH) and restrictive lung disease, complicated by respiratory insufficiency, who was successfully treated with nasal intermittent positive airway pressure (NIPPV) and oxygen
NIPPV therapy turned out to be effective on arterial gas exchange and well tolerated
Moreover, progressive dilatation of the aortic root was attenuated during NIPPV, but could, however, not be reversed
We hypothetized that (at least partially) a decrease of nocturnal intrathoracic pressures could explain this
